blocks.name: cmo
blocks.content: Extend class notation with the modulo operation.
blocks.origin: const class cmo { mod }

blocks.name: diff.cmo.s
diff.cmo.c
diff.cmo.w
df-mod
blocks.content: Define the modulo (remainder) operation. See ~ modval for its value. For example, ` ( 5 mod 3 ) = 2 ` and ` ( -u 7 mod 2 ) = 1 ` ( ~ ex-mod ). (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: modval
blocks.content: The value of the modulo operation. The modulo congruence notation of number theory, ` J == K ` (modulo ` N ` ), can be expressed in our notation as ` ( J mod N ) = ( K mod N ) ` . Definition 1 in Knuth, _The Art of Computer Programming_, Vol. I (1972), p. 38. Knuth uses "mod" for the operation and "modulo" for the congruence. Unlike Knuth, we restrict the second argument to positive reals to simplify certain theorems. (This also gives us future flexibility to extend it to any one of several different conventions for a zero or negative second argument, should there be an advantage in doing so.) (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
blocks.origin:
thm modval(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))))
} = {
  ovmpt2(hs0, hs1, c0, cr, c1, crp, cmo, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), co(cv(hs0), cmin, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(cv(hs0), cdiv, cv(hs1))))), co(c0, cmin, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1))))))
  mpdan(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmin, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(cv(hs0), cdiv, cv(hs1))))), co(c0, cmin, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1)))))), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(cv(hs0), cdiv, cv(hs1)))), co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1))))))
  oveq2d(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(cv(hs0), cdiv, cv(hs1))), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1))), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  fvoveq1(cv(hs0), c0, cfl, cdiv, cv(hs1))
  oveq12(cv(hs0), c0, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(cv(hs0), cdiv, cv(hs1)))), co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1)))), cmin)
  oveq2d(c0, cmin, co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1)))), co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  mpdan(wceq(cv(hs1), c1), wceq(co(cv(hs1), cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1)))), co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wceq(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1))), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
  fveq2d(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1)), co(c0, cdiv, c1), wceq(cv(hs1), c1))
  oveq2(cv(hs1), c1, c0, cdiv)
  oveq12(cv(hs1), c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, cv(hs1))), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul)
  df-mod(hs0, hs1)
  ovex(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(crp)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))))
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cr)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(crp)
  diff.hs1.c(co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))))
}

blocks.name: modvalr
blocks.content: The value of the modulo operation (multiplication in reversed order). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 14-Apr-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm modvalr(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c0, cmin, co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1))))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c0, cmin, co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1)), co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  modval(c0, c1)
  oveq2d(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  mulcomd(c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcn(c1)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wcel(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cc), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr))
  rerpdivcl(c0, c1)
  recnd(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr))
  reflcl(co(c0, cdiv, c1))
}

blocks.name: modcl
blocks.content: Closure law for the modulo operation. (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: flpmodeq
blocks.content: Partition of a division into its integer part and the remainder. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 14-Apr-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm flpmodeq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1), caddc, co(c0, cmo, c1)), c0))
} = {
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1), caddc, co(c0, cmo, c1)), c0), wceq(co(c0, cmin, co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1)), co(c0, cmo, c1)))
  eqcomd(co(c0, cmin, co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1)), co(c0, cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  modvalr(c0, c1)
  subaddd(c0, co(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmul, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  mulcld(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wcel(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cc), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr))
  rerpdivcl(c0, c1)
  zcnd(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr))
  flcl(co(c0, cdiv, c1))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcn(c1)
  recnd(co(c0, cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  modcl(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: modcld
blocks.content: Closure law for the modulo operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2016.)

blocks.name: mod0
blocks.content: ` A mod B ` is zero iff ` A ` is evenly divisible by ` B ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Fan Zheng, 7-Jun-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm mod0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz)))
} = {
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz), wceq(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), co(c0, cdiv, c1)))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wceq(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wceq(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wceq(co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), nat0))
  eqeq1d(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  modval(c0, c1)
  subeq0ad(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  recnd(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  remulcld(c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cr))
  rpre(c1)
  syl5rbbr(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wceq(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wceq(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
  eqcom(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wceq(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wceq(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cc), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  recnd(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  refldivcl(c0, c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wa(wcel(c1, cc), wne(c1, nat0)))
  rpcnne0(c1)
  divmul2(c0, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), c1)
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wceq(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr))
  rerpdivcl(c0, c1)
  flidz(co(c0, cdiv, c1))
}

blocks.name: mulmod0
blocks.content: The product of an integer and a positive real number is 0 modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.) (Revised by AV, 5-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm mulmod0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c1), nat0))
} = {
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cdiv, c1), cz))
  eqeltrd(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cdiv, c1), cz, c0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)))
  divcan4d(c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c0, cc))
  zcn(c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcn(c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wne(c1, nat0))
  rpne0(c1)
  simpl(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp))
  sylancom(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wb(wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cdiv, c1), cz)), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cr))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cr), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr))
  zre(c0)
  rpre(c1)
  remulcl(c0, c1)
  mod0(co(c0, cmul, c1), c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mulmod0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+)→((c0[×]c1)[mod]c1)= 0)
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), ((c0[×]c1)[mod]c1)= 0, ((c0[×]c1)[÷]c1)∈ ℤ)
  eqeltrd(((c0[×]c1)[÷]c1), cz, c0, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  divcan4d(c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  zcn(c0)
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  rpcn(c1)
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ≠ 0)
  rpne0(c1)
  simpl(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+)
  sylancom(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (((c0[×]c1)[mod]c1)= 0 ↔((c0[×]c1)[÷]c1)∈ ℤ), (c0[×]c1)∈ ℝ)
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, (c0[×]c1)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ)
  zre(c0)
  rpre(c1)
  remulcl(c0, c1)
  mod0((c0[×]c1), c1)
}

blocks.name: negmod0
blocks.content: ` A ` is divisible by ` B ` iff its negative is. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Fan Zheng, 7-Jun-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm negmod0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wceq(co(cneg(c0), cmo, c1), nat0)))
} = {
  3bitr4d(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0), wceq(co(cneg(c0), cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz), wcel(co(cneg(c0), cdiv, c1), cz))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz), wcel(co(cneg(c0), cdiv, c1), cz), wcel(cneg(co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cz))
  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cz), wcel(cneg(co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cz)), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cr), wcel(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cc))
  rerpdivcl(c0, c1)
  recn(co(c0, cdiv, c1))
  znegclb(co(c0, cdiv, c1))
  eleq1d(cneg(co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cz, co(cneg(c0), cdiv, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  divnegd(c0, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c0, cc))
  recn(c0)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcn(c1)
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wne(c1, nat0))
  rpne0(c1)
  mod0(c0, c1)
  sylan(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wb(wceq(co(cneg(c0), cmo, c1), nat0), wcel(co(cneg(c0), cdiv, c1), cz)), wcel(cneg(c0), cr))
  renegcl(c0)
  mod0(cneg(c0), c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm negmod0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+)→((c0[mod]c1)= 0 ↔(-u(c0)[mod]c1)= 0))
} = {
  3bitr4d((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), (c0[mod]c1)= 0, (-u(c0)[mod]c1)= 0, (c0[÷]c1)∈ ℤ, (-u(c0)[÷]c1)∈ ℤ)
  bitrd((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), (c0[÷]c1)∈ ℤ, (-u(c0)[÷]c1)∈ ℤ, -u((c0[÷]c1))∈ ℤ)
  3syl((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+), ((c0[÷]c1)∈ ℤ ↔ -u((c0[÷]c1))∈ ℤ), (c0[÷]c1)∈ ℝ, (c0[÷]c1)∈ ℂ)
  rerpdivcl(c0, c1)
  recn((c0[÷]c1))
  znegclb((c0[÷]c1))
  eleq1d(-u((c0[÷]c1)), cz, (-u(c0)[÷]c1), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  divnegd(c0, c1, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+))
  adantr(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  rpcn(c1)
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ≠ 0)
  rpne0(c1)
  mod0(c0, c1)
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+, ((-u(c0)[mod]c1)= 0 ↔(-u(c0)[÷]c1)∈ ℤ), -u(c0)∈ ℝ)
  renegcl(c0)
  mod0(-u(c0), c1)
}

blocks.name: modge0
blocks.content: The modulo operation is nonnegative. (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm modge0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(c0, cmo, c1)))
} = {
  breqtrrd(nat0, cle, co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wbr(nat0, cle, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))), wbr(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cle, c0))
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wbr(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cle, c0), wbr(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cle, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))
  fldivle(c0, c1)
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wb(wbr(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cle, c0), wbr(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cle, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wcel(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cr), wcel(c0, cr), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, clt, c1)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(nat0, clt, c1)))
  rpregt0(c1)
  lemuldiv2(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), c0, c1)
  syldan(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wb(wbr(nat0, cle, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))), wbr(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cle, c0)), wcel(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cr))
  remulcld(c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c1, cr))
  rpre(c1)
  refldivcl(c0, c1)
  subge0(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
  modval(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: modlt
blocks.content: The modulo operation is less than its second argument. (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm modlt(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wbr(co(c0, cmo, c1), clt, c1))
} = {
  eqbrtrd(co(c0, cmo, c1), clt, c1, co(c1, cmul, co(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cmin, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  3eqtr4rd(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmul, co(co(c0, cdiv, c1), cmin, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), co(co(c1, cmul, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))

blocks.name: modelico
blocks.content: Modular reduction produces a half-open interval. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 12-Sep-2014.)

blocks.name: moddiffl
blocks.content: Value of the modulo operation rewritten to give two ways of expressing the quotient when " ` A ` is divided by ` B ` using Euclidean division." Multiplying both sides by ` B ` , this implies that ` A mod B ` differs from ` A ` by an integer multiple of ` B ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 17-Jun-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Sep-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm moddiffl(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmo, c1)), cdiv, c1), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(co(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmo, c1)), cdiv, c1), cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), co(co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), cdiv, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  oveq1d(co(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmo, c1)), cdiv, c1, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  eqtrd(co(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmo, c1)), co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), co(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  oveq2d(c0, cmin, co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c0, cmin, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  modval(c0, c1)
  nncand(c0, co(c1, cmul, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  recnd(c0, wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp))
  mulcld(c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  divcan3d(c1, cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  zcnd(cfv(cfl, co(c0, cdiv, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))

  rpne0(c1)
}

blocks.name: moddifz
blocks.content: The modulo operation differs from ` A ` by an integer multiple of ` B ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jul-2014.)

blocks.name: modfrac

blocks.name: flmod
blocks.content: The floor function expressed in terms of the modulo operation. (Contributed by NM, 11-Nov-2008.)

blocks.name: intfrac
blocks.content: Break a number into its integer part and its fractional part. (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2008.)

blocks.name: zmod10
blocks.content: An integer modulo 1 is 0. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: zmod1congr
blocks.content: Two arbitrary integers are congruent modulo 1, see example 4 in [ApostolNT] p. 107. (Contributed by AV, 21-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: zmodcl
blocks.content: Closure law for the modulo operation restricted to integers. (Contributed by NM, 27-Nov-2008.)

thm zmodcl(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ)→(c0[mod]c1)∈ ℕ0)
} = {
  sylanbrc((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ), (c0[mod]c1)∈ ℕ0, (c0[mod]c1)∈ ℤ, 0[≤](c0[mod]c1))
  eqeltrd((c0[mod]c1), cz, (c0[-](c1[×](⌊ `(c0[÷]c1)))), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ, (c0[mod]c1)=(c0[-](c1[×](⌊ `(c0[÷]c1)))), c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+)
  modval(c0, c1)
  syldan(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ, (c0[-](c1[×](⌊ `(c0[÷]c1))))∈ ℤ, (c1[×](⌊ `(c0[÷]c1)))∈ ℤ)
  zmulcld(c1, (⌊ `(c0[÷]c1)), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  adantl(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  nnz(c1)
  flcld((c0[÷]c1), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℕ))
  sylan(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ, (c0[÷]c1)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ)
  nndivre(c0, c1)
  zsubcl(c0, (c1[×](⌊ `(c0[÷]c1))))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ, 0[≤](c0[mod]c1), c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ+)
  zre(c0)
  nnrp(c1)
  modge0(c0, c1)
  elnn0z((c0[mod]c1))
}

  3impa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(c2, crp), wa(wcel(co(c0, cmo, c1), cr), wcel(c2, crp)))
  anim1i(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wcel(c2, crp), wcel(co(c0, cmo, c1), cr))

  ltletrd((c0[mod]c1), c2, c1, ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+)∧ c1[≤]c2))
  adantr((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ+ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+), c1[≤]c2, (c0[mod]c1)∈ ℝ)

}

  jca((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+), (c0[mod]c2)∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℝ+)

  addcomd((c0[mod]c2), c1, (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+))

blocks.name: modaddmod
blocks.content: The sum of a real number modulo a positive real number and another real number equals the sum of the two real numbers modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 13-May-2018.)

blocks.name: muladdmodid
blocks.content: The sum of a positive real number less than an upper bound and the product of an integer and the upper bound is the positive real number modulo the upper bound. (Contributed by AV, 5-Jul-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm muladdmodid(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  rpxr(c1)

  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)), w3a(wcel(c2, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1)), wceq(co(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), caddc, c2), cmo, c1), c2))
  3eqtrd(co(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), caddc, c2), cmo, c1), c2, co(co(c2, caddc, co(c0, cmul, c1)), cmo, c1), co(c2, cmo, c1), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp)), w3a(wcel(c2, cr), wbr(nat0, cle, c2), wbr(c2, clt, c1))))

  syl2an(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, crp), wcel(co(c0, cmul, c1), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))

blocks.name: negmod
blocks.content: The negation of a number modulo a positive number is equal to the difference of the modulus and the number modulo the modulus. (Contributed by AV, 5-Jul-2020.)

  oveq1d(co(co(nat1, cmul, c1), caddc, cneg(c0)), cmo, c1, co(c1, caddc, cneg(c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))

  adantl(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wceq(co(nat1, cmul, c1), c1))

  eqtrd(co(co(co(nat1, cmul, c1), caddc, cneg(c0)), cmo, c1), co(cneg(c0), cmo, c1), co(co(cneg(c0), caddc, co(nat1, cmul, c1)), cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  oveq1d(co(co(nat1, cmul, c1), caddc, cneg(c0)), cmo, c1, co(cneg(c0), caddc, co(nat1, cmul, c1)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))

  ⊢ (c0 ∈(ℤ≥ ` 3)→ 1[<](-u(1)[mod]c0))

blocks.name: modadd2mod
blocks.content: The sum of a real number modulo a positive real number and another real number equals the sum of the two real numbers modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)

thm modadd2mod(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)), wceq(co(co(c1, caddc, co(c0, cmo, c2)), cmo, c2), co(co(c1, caddc, c0), cmo, c2)))
} = {
  3eqtrd(co(co(c1, caddc, co(c0, cmo, c2)), cmo, c2), co(co(c1, caddc, c0), cmo, c2), co(co(co(c0, cmo, c2), caddc, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmo, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)))
  oveq1d(co(c1, caddc, co(c0, cmo, c2)), cmo, c2, co(co(c0, cmo, c2), caddc, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)))
  addcomd(c1, co(c0, cmo, c2), w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp), wcel(c1, cc))
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp), wcel(co(c0, cmo, c2), cc))
  recnd(co(c0, cmo, c2), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c2, crp)))
  modcl(c0, c2)
  modaddmod(c0, c1, c2)
  3adant3(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c1, caddc, c0), cmo, c2)))
  oveq1d(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmo, c2, co(c1, caddc, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  syl2an(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wceq(co(c0, caddc, c1), co(c1, caddc, c0)), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))
  recn(c0)
  recn(c1)
  addcom(c0, c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm modadd2mod(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+)→((c1[+](c0[mod]c2))[mod]c2)=((c1[+]c0)[mod]c2))
} = {
  3eqtrd(((c1[+](c0[mod]c2))[mod]c2), ((c1[+]c0)[mod]c2), (((c0[mod]c2)[+]c1)[mod]c2), ((c0[+]c1)[mod]c2), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+))
  oveq1d((c1[+](c0[mod]c2)), cmo, c2, ((c0[mod]c2)[+]c1), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+))
  addcomd(c1, (c0[mod]c2), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+))
  3ad2ant2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℝ+, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  3adant2(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℝ+, (c0[mod]c2)∈ ℂ)
  recnd((c0[mod]c2), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c2 ∈ ℝ+))
  modcl(c0, c2)
  modaddmod(c0, c1, c2)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, c2 ∈ ℝ+, ((c0[+]c1)[mod]c2)=((c1[+]c0)[mod]c2))
  oveq1d((c0[+]c1), cmo, c2, (c1[+]c0), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  syl2an(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ, (c0[+]c1)=(c1[+]c0), c0 ∈ ℂ, c1 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(c0)
  recn(c1)
  addcom(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: modm1p1mod0
blocks.content: If a real number modulo a positive real number equals the positive real number decreased by 1, the real number increased by 1 modulo the positive real number equals 0. (Contributed by AV, 2-Nov-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm modm1p1mod0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wi(wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), nat0)))
} = {
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), nat0))

  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), co(co(co(c0, cmo, c1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1)))
  eqcomd(co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), co(co(co(c0, cmo, c1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)))
  mp3an2(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp), wceq(co(co(co(c0, cmo, c1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), co(co(c0, caddc, nat1), cmo, c1)), wcel(nat1, cr))
  1re()
  modaddmod(c0, nat1, c1)
  sylan9eqr(co(co(co(c0, cmo, c1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), nat0, co(co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, crp)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1)))
  oveq1d(co(co(c0, cmo, c1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1, co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1)))
  oveq1(co(c0, cmo, c1), co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1)

  eqtrd(co(co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1), nat0, co(c1, cmo, c1), wcel(c1, crp))
  oveq1d(co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1), cmo, c1, c1, wcel(c1, crp))
  syl(wcel(c1, crp), wceq(co(co(c1, cmin, nat1), caddc, nat1), c1), wcel(c1, cc))
  rpcn(c1)
  npcan1(c1)
  modid0(c1)
}

blocks.name: modltm1p1mod
blocks.content: If a real number modulo a positive real number is less than the positive real number decreased by 1, the real number increased by 1 modulo the positive real number equals the real number modulo the positive real number increased by 1. (Contributed by AV, 2-Nov-2018.)

blocks.name: modmul1

blocks.name: modmul12d
blocks.content: Multiplication property of the modulo operation, see theorem 5.2(b) in [ApostolNT] p. 107. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm modmul12d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmul, c4), cmo, c2)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, crp))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cmo, c2), co(c3, cmo, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c1, cmo, c2), co(c4, cmo, c2)))
} = {
  eqtrd(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmul, c4), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmul, c1), cmo, c2), w0)
  syl221anc(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmul, c1), cmo, c2)), wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c3, cr), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c2, crp), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c2), co(c3, cmo, c2)))
  zred(c0, w0)
  zred(c3, w0)
  modmul1(c0, c3, c1, c2)
  3eqtrd(co(co(c3, cmul, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmul, c4), cmo, c2), co(co(c1, cmul, c3), cmo, c2), co(co(c4, cmul, c3), cmo, c2), w0)
  oveq1d(co(c3, cmul, c1), cmo, c2, co(c1, cmul, c3), w0)
  mulcomd(c3, c1, w0)
  zcnd(c1, w0)
  syl221anc(w0, wceq(co(co(c1, cmul, c3), cmo, c2), co(co(c4, cmul, c3), cmo, c2)), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c4, cr), wcel(c3, cz), wcel(c2, crp), wceq(co(c1, cmo, c2), co(c4, cmo, c2)))
  zred(c1, w0)
  zred(c4, w0)
  modmul1(c1, c4, c3, c2)
  oveq1d(co(c4, cmul, c3), cmo, c2, co(c3, cmul, c4), w0)
  mulcomd(c4, c3, w0)
  zcnd(c4, w0)
  zcnd(c3, w0)
}

  ⊢ (w0 →((c0[×]c1)[mod]c2)=((c3[×]c4)[mod]c2))

  syl221anc(w0, ((c0[×]c1)[mod]c2)=((c3[×]c1)[mod]c2), c0 ∈ ℝ, c3 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c2 ∈ ℝ+, (c0[mod]c2)=(c3[mod]c2))

  zred(c3, w0)

  3eqtrd(((c3[×]c1)[mod]c2), ((c3[×]c4)[mod]c2), ((c1[×]c3)[mod]c2), ((c4[×]c3)[mod]c2), w0)

  zred(c1, w0)
  zred(c4, w0)

blocks.name: modnegd

thm modnegd(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(cneg(c0), cmo, c1), co(cneg(c2), cmo, c1)))

  znegcld(nat1, w0)
  1zzd(w0)
  modmul1(c0, c2, cneg(nat1), c1)

  mulcomd(c0, cneg(nat1), w0)
  mulm1d(c0, w0)
  recnd(c0, w0)
  oveq1d(co(c2, cmul, cneg(nat1)), cmo, c1, cneg(c2), w0)
  eqtrd(co(c2, cmul, cneg(nat1)), cneg(c2), co(cneg(nat1), cmul, c2), w0)
  mulcomd(c2, cneg(nat1), w0)
  negcld(nat1, w0)
  1cnd(w0)
  mulm1d(c2, w0)
  recnd(c2, w0)

blocks.content: Additive property of the modulo operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2016.)

thm modadd12d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  oveq1d(co(c3, caddc, c1), cmo, c2, co(c1, caddc, c3), w0)

  recnd(c1, w0)

  modadd1(c1, c4, c3, c2)

blocks.content: Subtraction property of the modulo operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2016.)

thm modsub12d(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmo, c2), co(co(c3, cmin, c4), cmo, c2)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cr))

  recnd(c4, w0)

blocks.name: modsubmod
blocks.content: The difference of a real number modulo a positive real number and another real number equals the difference of the two real numbers modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)

blocks.name: modsubmodmod
blocks.content: The difference of a real number modulo a positive real number and another real number modulo this positive real number equals the difference of the two real numbers modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm modsubmodmod(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)), wceq(co(co(co(c0, cmo, c2), cmin, co(c1, cmo, c2)), cmo, c2), co(co(c0, cmin, c1), cmo, c2)))
} = {
  modsub12d(co(c0, cmo, c2), co(c1, cmo, c2), c2, c0, c1, w3a(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr), wcel(c2, crp)))

blocks.name: modmulmod
blocks.content: The product of a real number modulo a positive real number and an integer equals the product of the real number and the integer modulo the positive real number. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-May-2018.)

blocks.name: modsumfzodifsn
blocks.content: The sum of a number within a half-open range of positive integers is an element of the corresponding open range of nonnegative integers with one excluded integer modulo the excluded integer. (Contributed by AV, 19-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: modlteq
blocks.content: Two nonnegative integers less than the modulus are equal iff they are equal modulo the modulus. (Contributed by AV, 14-Mar-2021.)

blocks.name: addmodlteq
blocks.content: Two nonnegative integers less than the modulus are equal iff the sums of these integer with another integer are equal modulo the modulus. A much shorter proof exists if the "divides" relation ` || ` can be used, see ~ addmodlteqALT . (Contributed by AV, 20-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:

  diff.hs0.w(wa(wcel(c0, co(nat0, cfzo, c1)), wcel(c2, co(nat0, cfzo, c1))))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(c0, c2))
}
